text: Brenda was a rural municipality in the province of Manitoba in Western Canada. It is near the province's southern border with North Dakota. In 2011, it had a population of 469 people. Brenda covered an area of 766.00 kmÂ² (295.75 square miles). The main settlements within the rural municipality were Goodlands, Leighton, Medora, and Napinka. In 2015, it became part of the Municipality of Brenda-Waskada. == References == Category:Settlements in Manitoba
title: Rural Municipality of Brenda
